poem:
**The Now of Change**

At 10 Downing, figures frame a dawn,
Starmer strides in, doctrine shorn.
Fields of promise, echoes hum,
In children's eyes, what dreams become.
Unburdened breath, a nation's voice,
Life's betterment, a fresher choice.

You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Change begins now,’ says Keir Starmer after Labour’s landslide election win – live 1.05pm BST The first pictures of prime minister Keir Starmer and his wife Victoria entering 10 Downing Street, which will be their new home, have arrived. 1.02pm BST My colleague Pippa Crerar picked up on this bit of Starmer’s speech, where he asked whether people believed that life was getting better for their children, before using that phrase “unburdened by doctrine”. Starmer". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
